climbs.name: For Kids of All Ages (aka "Tricks Are for Kids")

content.description: I was asked to put this route in by a respected local climber: “ The climb is mistakenly named "Tricks are for Kids" on page 277 of the 2012 guidebook "North Conway Rock Climbs". " A good route that may need to be cleaned. Climbs the thin crack in the headwall to the right of Guido's Delight.  Go around the overhang on the right to gain the thin crack up the steep slab. Originally established with no fixed protection."
content.protection: Std rack - the guidebook mentions a fixed pin at the corner...but how old now?!
content.location: This climb STARTs on the face a few feet right of the right-facing corner capped by a 4-foot roof ("Guido's climbs this corner).

content.description: Way more known for it's ice, there are several rock climbs here, and at least a couple of the ice & mixed climbs were first done as rock climbs.The following climbs, listed in the Trollville "Ice" area ( mountainproject.com/area/10…) are also rock climbs:  Dreadlocks  FA Ray Rice 2004  5.11d Purple People Eater  FA  John Tremblay 1980's  5.8
